comments.author: alexschrank@me.com
comments.creator: alexschrank@me.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_7_2) AppleWebKit/535.2 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/15.0.874.106 Safari/535.2

Steps to reproduce:

I went to antiphishing.org and submitted a phishing email to them.


Actual results:

The browser froze, became unclickable, and every time I tried to click a part of the browser bar the color would change from a darker grey to a lighter grey in that particular section, and just acted weird.  Then, when I went to take a screenshot (Command+Shift+4 Mac) I dragged the screenshot cursor selector across the screen which progressively unfroze the browser relative to the screenshot box.


Expected results:

The form should've submitted and taken me back to the APWG homepage as normal.
